creator: philip42
title: Adding a VU Meter to your PC
materials_required: 5.25” all-in-one adapter (Ultra Media Dashboard or similar)
description: This project details how to add a stereo LED VU meter to a PC, displaying the audio output on a visual meter. It involves tapping into the computer's audio output and providing power to the VU meter module, as well as creating a custom faceplate for mounting the meter.
steps: Obtain a stereo LED VU meter kit and a 5.25” all-in-one adapter (like the Ultra Media Dashboard) to provide front panel audio jacks if the computer case lacks them.
Identify the AC97 audio connector on the motherboard and determine the pins for ground, right audio, and left audio (pins 2, 5, and 9 respectively). Verify with a voltmeter.
Use telephone tap connectors to tap into the ground, right audio, and left audio lines from the AC97 connector.  Connect these to the audio input of the VU meter.
Repurpose an old internal CD audio cable for the VU meter's three-pin audio connector, reconfiguring the connector if necessary.
Cut apart a Molex Y power splitter cable to obtain a male Molex 4-pin connector to power the VU board with 12 volts.
Modify a 5.25" faceplate by drilling holes for the VU meter's LEDs, using a template for accuracy. Consider using a laser cutter or a drill press with a self-adhesive template.
Paint the drilled faceplate to the desired color. In the original project, copper paint was used due to lack of black paint

Adapt a nylon mounting bracket to attach to the back of the faceplate. Glue the plastic pieces permanently to the faceplate and attach the VU board to the plastic brackets with small nylon screws and nuts.
Connect the audio and power cables to the VU meter board and test the functionality, verifying that the audio channels are correctly aligned using test videos.
